resumeData.name: ADITYA TIWARY
resumeData.summary: Board-certified Medical Doctor with 8 years of clinical practice specializing in Internal Medicine. Managed a diverse patient population, conducting over 5,000 patient consultations annually. Skilled in diagnosis, treatment planning, and patient education. Committed to providing evidence-based care with a compassionate approach. Seeking to leverage my clinical expertise at Chicago Memorial Hospital.

experience.title: Attending Physician
experience.accomplishment:
• Led a team of 5 residents and 3 medical students in a busy internal medicine department
• Diagnosed and treated 30+ patients daily with various acute and chronic conditions
• Performed 200+ medical procedures including lumbar punctures and central line placements
• Reduced hospital readmission rates by 15% through comprehensive discharge planning
• Published 3 research papers in peer-reviewed medical journals on chronic disease management

experience.title: Resident Physician
experience.accomplishment:
• Completed comprehensive training in internal medicine treating 1000+ patients annually
• Conducted daily rounds for 15-20 patients, formulating treatment plans and follow-up care
• Participated in 150+ emergency room consultations and admissions
• Achieved 95% patient satisfaction scores based on hospital surveys
• Presented 5 case studies at departmental conferences on complex medical conditions

experience.title: Medical Intern
experience.accomplishment:
• Rotated through various specialties including cardiology, pulmonology, and gastroenterology
• Assisted attending physicians in diagnosing and treating 500+ patients
• Participated in 75+ medical procedures under direct supervision
• Completed electronic medical record documentation for 20+ patients daily
• Received Excellence in Patient Care award for exceptional bedside manner

education.institution: University of Illinois College of Medicine

philosophy.quote: The good physician treats the disease; the great physician treats the patient who has the disease.
philosophy.author: — William Osler

strengths.title: Clinical Reasoning
strengths.description: Able to analyze complex symptoms and medical histories to arrive at accurate diagnoses.

strengths.title: Crisis Management
strengths.description: Maintain composure and sound decision-making under high-pressure emergency situations.

strengths.title: Empathetic Communication
strengths.description: Skilled at explaining complex medical concepts to patients in an understandable and compassionate way.

achievements.title: Research Publication
achievements.description: Lead author on a study published in the New England Journal of Medicine on innovative approaches to chronic disease management, 2020.

references.name: Dr. Sarah Williams
references.title: Chief of Medicine, Northwestern Memorial Hospital
